definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Keen on Science, away from Superstition, to Raise Populace Quality.
sentences.chinese: 学习科学，破除迷信，提高素质。

sentences.english: History proved that revolution was the violentest storm.
sentences.chinese: 历史证明，革命是破除迷信最猛烈的风暴。

sentences.english: Scientific explanations offer an alternative to superstition.
sentences.chinese: 科学的解释为破除迷信提供了一种途径。

sentences.english: We should do away with all superstitions and emancipate the mind.
sentences.chinese: 我们要破除迷信，解放思想。

definition: Destroy the Four Olds (campaign of the Cultural Revolution)
materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
the Four Olds (target of the Cultural Revolution)
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
superstition/to have a superstitious belief (in sth)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
theism (the belief in the existence of God)
